MS written by Carl Wilhelmi and signed by M. Melbourne bot. & zoolog. Garden

By desire of the Gentlemen constituting the Committee of the Zoological Garden,
anything relevant in Cmttee minutes?
I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the appropriation of one hundred and fifty pounds Sterling out of the vote for purchase of animals for the introduction of Chinese sheep, and that you will be pleased, should the Committees proposal meet with your approval, to cause the above sum to be placed to the credit of Mr Lyall, M.L.A., who has kindly undertaken the arrangements for importing these useful animals.
